page.title: 06Changing Times in Kimpton
page.content: After interviewing several life-long inhabitants of the village it is possible to ascertain how the village has changed since 1900.With 7 public houses,10 shops,2 breweries and a bank it was possible to live entirely in the village.Motor traffic has replaced the horse, causing a parking problem. Many changes have been good like the building of sheltered accommodation for the elderly:Probyn House. Some were not popular like the demolition of historic buildings to make way for new houses.This interferred with natural drainage causing increased flooding in the High Street,which has not yet been solved.Recently,levelling the Recreation Ground for the Football Club has left little play-space.To monitor future changes Kimpton Protection Group has been formed.
